Description: Rim sherd of Attic pottery Gordion cup; interior: glazed black with thin reserved line at lip; exterior: glazed black, reserved line at top of cul.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.424; 1888,0601.425; 1888,0601.427; 1948,0815.1; 1948,0815.2 and Cambridge, Fitzwilliam GR.206.1894. See Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., 231, A17, pl. 25.
Bibliographic references: Robertson 1951 / Gordion cups from Naukratis (p. 143, no 1)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 381, no. B533)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 153, note 82)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 230, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0423) (Phase 1)
